info.document:
REUTERS TELEVISION OUTLOOK FOR SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 17, 2017
EDITORS PLEASE NOTE: SLUGS AND TIMINGS ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE 
LIVE 
0050-0315/0650-0815GMT 
MYANMAR-ROHINGYA/BANGLADESH CAMP
COX'S BAZAR, BANGLADESH - A look at the life of Rohingya refugees in the Kutupalong camp.
REUTERS (ACCESS ALL)
EDITS
17/09 MYANMAR-ROHINGYA/: COX'S BAZAR, BANGLADESH - Bangladesh struggles to cope with about 400,000 Rohingya refugees fleeing violence in Myanmar, while aid agencies call for ramped-up efforts to ease the crisis. DELIVERY AS AVAILABLE
17/09 CHINA-HENGQIN/ECONOMY: HENGQIN - Chinese investors are ploughing billions of dollars into a special economic zone on China's southern coast to reshape the former sleepy island into the country's biggest holiday hub. EXPECT 0400GMT FOR BIZVID 
17/09 CHINA-GERMANY/: BEIJING - German Foreign Minister Sigmar Gabriel meets with Chinese state councillor Yang Jiechi in Beijing. EXPECT 1130GMT 
17/09 CHINA-TEMPLE/: SHANGHAI - The Main Hall of Shanghai's Yufo Temple, or Jade Buddha Temple, is shifted 30.66 metres northward along with three huge Buddhist statues to eliminate safety risks. DELIVERY TBA
17/09 PAKISTAN-POLITICS/: SINGAPORE - Kulsoom Nawaz, wife of former prime minister Nawaz Sharif is expected to contest in a by-poll for a seat that fell vacant after the Supreme Court on July 28 disqualified her husband in the Panama Papers case over charges of concealing his wealth. A total of 44 candidates will contest the NA-120 by-poll. DELIVERY TBA
17/09 RUGBY-UNION-CHAMPIONSHIP-AUS-ARG/: CANBERRA - Post match news conferences with Australia's Wallabies and Argentina's Pumas in Canberra. DELIVERY TBA FOR SPORTS 
THE FOLLOWING FILE IS AVAILABLE ON WNE
03/09 7066 CAMBODIA-POLITICS/OPPOSITION-FILE 
03/09 0006 NORTHKOREA-NUCLEAR/FILE
14/09 1225-NORTHKOREA-MISSILES/FILE
Reuters Television, Asia Desk
+65-6870-3795
